analyzed: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa dran zhing shes bzhin du ting nge 'dzin de las langs so //

translated: Immediately after Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta arose, the buddhafields in the ten directions, innumerable in extent, shook in six ways.

original: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas 'du shes kyi rnam par rtog pa yid la byed pa 'di lta bu 'di skyes te /

translated: “The appearance of the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas in the world is once in a hundred eons.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper @4b na; au dum wa ra'i me tog brgya la brgya lam na 'jig rten du 'byung ba de bzhin du gang dag skye ba'i sdug bsngal zad par bya ba'i phyir zhi ba gsal ba /

translated: Just as the udumbara flower appears in the world only once every hundred years, in the same way, the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas appear in the world only once every hundred years in order to teach the Dharma that is peaceful,

original: brtag tu med pa /
analyzed: brtag tu med pa /
translated: subtle,

original: rtog ge dang bral ba /
analyzed: rtog ge dang bral ba /
translated: beyond speculation,

original: zab pa shes par dka' ba'i chos ston pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyang brgya la brgya lam na 'jig rten du 'byung ngo //

translated: and profound and difficult to understand, in order to bring an end to the suffering of birth.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba med pa na ni chos mnyan pa yang med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba med pa na ni chos mnyan pa yang med do //
translated: “When there is no appearance of a buddha, there is no opportunity to listen to the Dharma.

original: chos mnyan pa med na ni sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal zad pa yang med pas bdag de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar song ste /

translated: Without the opportunity to listen to the Dharma, there is no end to the suffering of sentient beings. Therefore, I will go before the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha.

original: zhu ba zhus pa ji lta bus sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsgrub par 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i gang zag rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag la nem nur med cing the tshom med par 'gyur ba dang /

original: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di'i sems can 'di dag ni 'dod chags che ba /🔽zhe sdang che ba /

translated: The sentient beings of this Sahā world system have great desire,🔽great anger,

original: gti mug che ba /
analyzed: gti mug che ba /
translated: and great ignorance.

original: dkar po'i chos dang bral ba /
analyzed: dkar po'i chos dang bral ba /

original: mi dge ba'i chos dang ldan pa /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos dang ldan pa /

original: sangs rgyas dang bral ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang bral ba /

original: chos dang bral ba /
analyzed: chos dang bral ba /
translated: devoid of the Dharma,

analyzed: dge 'dun dang bral ba sha stag yin pas /

translated: How can these sentient beings, having heard the Dharma, attain the eye of insight🔽and the eye of Dharma?

analyzed: rnam par dag par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i zhu ba zhu'o snyam mo //

translated: They sat cross-legged on the heart of lotuses that had arisen from their own aspirations, with many hundreds of thousands of petals in various colors.

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas /
translated: He bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined and

original: bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis mngon par bstod do //
translated: praised the Blessed One with these verses:

original: rab dga' bde ba stsol ba shin tu dri ma med pa'i zhal //
analyzed: rab dga' bde ba stsol ba shin tu dri ma med pa'i zhal //
translated: “Your face is utterly stainless, bestowing joy and bliss,

original: mi yi dam pa stobs bcu yon tan brgya dag nges bsags pa //
analyzed: mi yi dam pa stobs bcu yon tan brgya dag nges bsags pa //
translated: “You are the best of humans, the one who has definitely accumulated the ten powers and a hundred qualities.

original: bsam yas gzhal du ma mchis yid gnyis mun pa sel ba po //
analyzed: bsam yas gzhal du ma mchis yid gnyis mun pa sel ba po //
translated: You are inconceivable, immeasurable, and dispel the darkness of doubt.

original: sa bla lha yul rnam par rgyu ba khyod dang mtshungs ma mchis //
analyzed: sa bla lha yul rnam par rgyu ba khyod dang mtshungs ma mchis //
translated: You move through the heavens and the realm of the gods, and there is no one equal to you.

original: bskal pa khrag @11b khrig brgyar sbyin dang dul ba legs par spyad //
analyzed: bskal pa khrag @11b khrig brgyar sbyin dang dul ba legs par spyad //

original: bde gshegs khyod kyi tshul khrims mtshungs pa ma mchis gnas ma mchis //
analyzed: bde gshegs khyod kyi tshul khrims mtshungs pa ma mchis gnas ma mchis //
translated: Sugata, your discipline is unequaled and has no basis.

original: bzod stobs shin tu stobs dang ldan pa stobs bcu'i stobs ldan pa //
analyzed: bzod stobs shin tu stobs dang ldan pa stobs bcu'i stobs ldan pa //
translated: You have the power of patience, the power of the ten powers,

analyzed: yon tan mnga' ba 'dzum mdzad bdag gi the tshom bsal du gsol //
translated: and you have the power of qualities. Please smile and dispel my doubts.

original: sems can sdug bsngal gzigs nas bskal pa brgya dag rnam spyad kyang //
analyzed: sems can sdug bsngal gzigs nas bskal pa brgya dag rnam spyad kyang //
translated: “You see the suffering of sentient beings and practice for a hundred eons,

analyzed: skyo zhing spong ba mi mnga' dgyes pa gzhal du ma mchis brnyes //
translated: but you are not weary and do not abandon them. You attain immeasurable joy.

original: sras dang sras mo btsun mo rgyal srid spyan dang sna tshogs btang //
analyzed: sras dang sras mo btsun mo rgyal srid spyan dang sna tshogs btang //
translated: You give away your sons, daughters, queens, and kingdoms.

original: sbyin dgyes thams cad gtong ba bdag gi the tshom bsal du gsol //
analyzed: sbyin dgyes thams cad gtong ba bdag gi the tshom bsal du gsol //
translated: I ask you to remove my doubts about giving away everything joyfully.

original: khyod kyis sngon chad chibs dang glang po shing rta dpung chung stsal //
analyzed: khyod kyis sngon chad chibs dang glang po shing rta dpung chung stsal //
translated: In the past you gave away horses, elephants, chariots, and troops,

original: gtong la dgyes pas dbu dang na bza' khrag khrig brgya yang btang //
analyzed: gtong la dgyes pas dbu dang na bza' khrag khrig brgya yang btang //
translated: And out of joy in giving, you gave away billions of your heads and clothes.

original: thub pas zhal zas gtsang nan de bzhin pho brang dkor yang stsal //
analyzed: thub pas zhal zas gtsang nan de bzhin pho brang dkor yang stsal //
translated: Sage, you gave away your pure food and drink, and likewise your palace and wealth.

original: sbyin dang gtong la rtag tu dgyes pa bde gshegs khyed la zhu //
analyzed: sbyin dang gtong la rtag tu dgyes pa bde gshegs khyed la zhu //
translated: Sugata, I ask you about your constant joy in giving and generosity.

original: stong pa'i chos rnams nges par bsten zhing thugs la legs dgongs pas //
analyzed: stong pa'i chos rnams nges par bsten zhing thugs la legs dgongs pas //
translated: You definitely relied on empty phenomena and contemplated them well,

original: rdul bral sku lus gtubs kyang sdug bsngal 'khrugs pa mi mnga' zhing //
analyzed: rdul bral sku lus gtubs kyang sdug bsngal 'khrugs pa mi mnga' zhing //
translated: So even though your body was cut up, you did not have any disturbance of suffering.

original: gsungs zhes zhus na bzod pa gsung ba'i stobs la brtson pa yi //
analyzed: gsungs zhes zhus na bzod pa gsung ba'i stobs la brtson pa yi //
translated: If asked, you would speak of patience, and you exerted yourself in the power of speech.

original: yon tan mnga' ba rdul dang bral ba khyod la zhu bar 'tshal //
analyzed: yon tan mnga' ba rdul dang bral ba khyod la zhu bar 'tshal //
translated: I ask you, one who has the dust-free qualities.

analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang dag gis rab dkrugs rmongs shing kun dkris la //
translated: You were disturbed by desire and anger, and you were confused and entangled,

original: bdag tu 'du shes brtson pa'i sems can sdug bsngal gzigs nas ni //
analyzed: bdag tu 'du shes brtson pa'i sems can sdug bsngal gzigs nas ni //
translated: Seeing sentient beings who are diligent in the perception of self and suffering,

original: thugs rje bskyed nas bskal pa brgya @12a *//
analyzed: thugs rje bskyed nas bskal pa brgya @12a *//
translated: Having generated compassion, for a hundred eons

original: dag srid pa 'dir spyad pa //
analyzed: dag srid pa 'dir spyad pa //
translated: You practiced in this existence.

original: dpa' bo lam rab ston par mdzad pa bdag gi skyabs gyur cig /
analyzed: dpa' bo lam rab ston par mdzad pa bdag gi skyabs gyur cig /
translated: Hero, who shows the supreme path, be my refuge!

original: bde gshegs legs pa mdzad pa khyod ni 'gro la thogs mi mnga'//
analyzed: bde gshegs legs pa mdzad pa khyod ni 'gro la thogs mi mnga'//
translated: Sugata, you are unobstructed to the world.

analyzed: spyad pa legs par spyad pas rdzu 'phrul zhabs dang ye shes brnyes //
translated: Through well-practiced conduct, you attained miraculous feet and wisdom.

original: bdag dang sems can rnam par bshig cing stong pa'i chos la brtson //
analyzed: bdag dang sems can rnam par bshig cing stong pa'i chos la brtson //
translated: Destroying self and sentient beings, you are diligent in the empty Dharma.

original: shin tu dri ma ma mchis bsam bsgom bdag gi the tshom khum //
analyzed: shin tu dri ma ma mchis bsam bsgom bdag gi the tshom khum //
translated: Meditating on the utterly stainless, please resolve my doubts.🔽In the past, you relied on incomparable generosity, discipline, patience, diligence,

original: khyod kyis sngon ni sbyin dang tshul khrims bzod pa brtson 'grus dang // bsam gtan shes rab snying rje byams pa mtshungs pa ma mchis bsten //
analyzed: khyod kyis sngon ni sbyin dang tshul khrims bzod pa brtson 'grus dang // bsam gtan shes rab snying rje byams pa mtshungs pa ma mchis bsten //
translated: Concentration, wisdom, compassion, and love.

original: khyod kyis yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab chu 'dzin rgya mtsho bzhin //
analyzed: khyod kyis yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab chu 'dzin rgya mtsho bzhin //
translated: Your qualities are inconceivable, like the four oceans.

original: 'byung gnas bzang po shin tu gnas pa bdag gi skyabs gyur cig /
analyzed: 'byung gnas bzang po shin tu gnas pa bdag gi skyabs gyur cig /
translated: May you be my refuge, O you who are the excellent source, the excellent abode!🔽“Your body, O stainless one, was cut into pieces and weighed on a scale,

original: rdul bral khyod kyi sku lus dum bu dum bur bcad cing ni; ;srang la bcal ba mdzad cing dam dum lhag grol ma lus par //
analyzed: rdul bral khyod kyi sku lus dum bu dum bur bcad cing ni; ;srang la bcal ba mdzad cing dam dum lhag grol ma lus par //
translated: and all the pieces, without exception, were exhausted.

original: sku kun ril gyis btang ste phug ron phrug gu gcig ma btang //
analyzed: sku kun ril gyis btang ste phug ron phrug gu gcig ma btang //
translated: You gave away your entire body, but you did not give a single pigeon.

original: rdul bral 'od mdzad thugs rje mnga' ba the tshom gcad du gsol //
analyzed: rdul bral 'od mdzad thugs rje mnga' ba the tshom gcad du gsol //
translated: O stainless one, O light-maker, O compassionate one, please resolve my doubt!

original: lha tshogs gnas pa'i ri bo g-yos shing dgung ni rdib gyur la //
analyzed: lha tshogs gnas pa'i ri bo g-yos shing dgung ni rdib gyur la //
translated: “The mountains where the hosts of gods dwell may shake, and the sky may fall;

original: lha ma yin gyi tshogs kyi gnas mal rgya mtsho bas gyur cig /
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi tshogs kyi gnas mal rgya mtsho bas gyur cig /
translated: the abode and bed of the hosts of asuras may become the ocean;

original: mkha' la gnas shing rgyu ba'i dgung zla dog sar lhung gyur kyang //
analyzed: mkha' la gnas shing rgyu ba'i dgung zla dog sar lhung gyur kyang //
translated: and the moon, which moves and dwells in the sky, may fall to the ground;

original: rgyal ba grags pa mdzad pa khyod ni log pa'i tshig mi gsung //
analyzed: rgyal ba grags pa mdzad pa khyod ni log pa'i tshig mi gsung //
translated: but you, O Victorious One, who have performed renowned deeds, would not utter a false word.”

original: de nas gnas brtan 'od srung chen pos bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa de dag gis @12b mngon par bstod nas /
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan 'od srung chen pos bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa de dag gis @12b mngon par bstod nas /
translated: Then the elder Mahākāśyapa, having praised the Blessed One with these verses,

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: He addressed the Buddha, saying:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: World-Honored One,

original: snang ba chen po 'jig rten du byung zhing ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i mtshan ma rgya chen po 'di lta bu gda' ba 'di'i rgyu ni gang lags /
analyzed: snang ba chen po 'jig rten du byung zhing ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i mtshan ma rgya chen po 'di lta bu gda' ba 'di'i rgyu ni gang lags /
translated: what is the reason for this great light in the world, this great wonder, this great auspicious sign?

original: rkyen ni gang lags /
analyzed: rkyen ni gang lags /
translated: What is the cause, what is the condition?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //

analyzed: 'od srung / 'di lta bu'i gtam dris pas khyod la ci zhig bya'i thong zhig /

analyzed: 'di ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sa ma yin no //

analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pas gnas 'di bstan par gyur na lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten 'di la rmongs shing bslad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the Tathagata were to explain this matter, the world with its gods, humans, and asuras would be confused and doubtful.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Kasyapa said to the Buddha:🔽World-Honored One,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas skye bo mang po la sman pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba'i slad du bshad du gsol /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas skye bo mang po la sman pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba'i slad du bshad du gsol /

analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //

analyzed: 'od srung / de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la yid la gzung zhig dang / bshad par bya'o //

analyzed: 'od srung / 'di na 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa kun du snang pa dri med bkod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Kāśyapa, here Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta has entered the samādhi called ‘Array of the Stainless Light of All Appearances.’

analyzed: de'i mthus phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gangg'a'i klung bye ba'i bye ma snyed dag @13a *//

analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang dag par bskul te /

original: 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir lhags nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir lhags nas /
translated: They came to this Sahā world system,

analyzed: de dag gis da gzod nga'i rkang pa la mgo bos phyag byas te /
translated: and they bowed their heads to my feet.

original: nga la lan gsum bskor ba byas nas /
analyzed: nga la lan gsum bskor ba byas nas /
translated: They circumambulated me three times

analyzed: steng gi bar snang la ta la srid tsam na padma dgal 'khod do //
translated: and then sat upon lotuses that appeared in the sky at the height of seven tāla trees.

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen pos 'di skad ces gsol to //

original: mtshungs pa med pa'i gzhi rnams dang / blang ba med pa'i gzhi rnams dang / dor ba med pa'i gzhi rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi gzhi rnams dang / chos kyi gzhi rnams dang / dge 'dun gyi gzhi rnams dang / ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa 'thob pa'i gzhi rnams dang /
analyzed: mtshungs pa med pa'i gzhi rnams dang / blang ba med pa'i gzhi rnams dang / dor ba med pa'i gzhi rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi gzhi rnams dang / chos kyi gzhi rnams dang / dge 'dun gyi gzhi rnams dang / ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa 'thob pa'i gzhi rnams dang /
translated: the bases of the unequaled, the bases of non-acceptance, the bases of non-rejection, the bases of the Buddha, the bases of the Dharma, the bases of the Saṅgha, the bases for attaining the perfection of wisdom,🔽the bases of the equality of the three realms, the bases of the non-apprehension of all phenomena, the bases of the teaching of the non-arising of all phenomena, the bases of the lion, the bases of the hero, and the bases of the baseless.

original: khams gsum pa mnyam pa nyid kyi gzhi rnams dang / chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i gzhi rnams dang / chos thams cad skye ba med par bstan pa'i gzhi rnams dang / seng ge'i gzhi rnams dang / dpa' bo'i gzhi rnams dang / gzhi med pa'i gzhi de dag bstan pa na snod du gyur pa ni su yod snyam mo //
analyzed: khams gsum pa mnyam pa nyid kyi gzhi rnams dang / chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i gzhi rnams dang / chos thams cad skye ba med par bstan pa'i gzhi rnams dang / seng ge'i gzhi rnams dang / dpa' bo'i gzhi rnams dang / gzhi med pa'i gzhi de dag bstan pa na snod du gyur pa ni su yod snyam mo //

analyzed: de nas yang 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa 'di snyam du sems te /

analyzed: lha'i bu blo gros rab gnas 'di ni sngon gyi rgyal ba la bya ba lhag par @21b byas pa /

analyzed: zab mo la bzod pa thogs pa med pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pa yin gyi /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar bdag 'di dang lhan cig tu dri ba bstan pa bshad par bya'o snyam mo //

analyzed: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas lha'i bu blo gros rab gnas la 'di skad ces smras so //

analyzed: lha'i bu / khyod ni zab mo la bzod pa thogs pa med pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pa yin na /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar kho bo dang lhan cig tu dri ba bstan pa bshad par nus sam /

analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / lha'i bu blo gros rab gnas kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //

analyzed: 'don par yang mi mdzad /

analyzed: rnam par rig par mi byed /

analyzed: thos nas kyang gzhan dag la ston par mi byed pa lta na /

analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal /

analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /

analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /

analyzed: bdag tu dmigs pa dang / sems can du dmigs pa dang / chos su dmigs pa'o //

analyzed: rlom sems su mi byed /

analyzed: lha'i bu / gang dag de ltar nyan pa de dag ni mnyam par nyan pa yin te /

analyzed: mi mnyam pa ma yin no //

analyzed: lha'i bu blo gros rab gnas kyis smras pa /

analyzed: legs so // 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /

analyzed: sangs rgyas su 'du shes pa las ldog go /

original: chos su 'du shes pa las ldog go /

analyzed: bdag sems can grol bar byed par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: bdag bdud 'dul bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: bdag ye shes thob par 'gyur ro snyam pa'i 'du shes de dag las ldog go /

analyzed: mtshan ma rnams la rtog par mi @23b byed do //

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing bkod pa rnams la rtog par mi byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing bkod pa rnams la rtog par mi byed do //

analyzed: lha'i bu / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' gang de las ldog pa de ni mi ldog pa yin no //

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /

analyzed: 'jam dpal / gang las mi ldog go /

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /

analyzed: lha'i bu / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes las mi ldog go /

analyzed: stong pa nyid las mi ldog go /

analyzed: @34b gang la mig gi spros pa med pa dang / gang la mig nga yi ba nyid med pa dang / gang la mig kun du bsrung ba med pa dang / gang la mig bsgom pa med pa dang / gang la mig blang ba med pa dang /

translated: in the same way, where there is no ear, nose, tongue, body, mind, form, sound, smell, taste, texture, or mental object, where there is no perception of mental objects,

translated: It is to not grasp at anything as a phenomenon. It is to not have the characteristics of phenomena. It is to not observe anything as a phenomenon. analyzed: gang la chos kun du bsrung ba med pa dang / @35a *//

original: yul med do //

translated: Some bodhisattvas had bodies five yojanas in size, some four, some three, some two, and some one yojana in size. Some bodhisattvas had bodies the size of the bodies of the beings of this Sahā world system, which is three quarters of an arm span.

analyzed: de dag gi lus de lta bu dag kun du snang ngo //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la skabs dbye bar gnang na /

analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa @36b dang; bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //

analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //

analyzed: 'jam dpal / chos thams cad rtog pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //

analyzed: lus rtogs par byed do //

original: yid rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: yid rtogs par byed do //

analyzed: 'jam dpal / ji ltar byang chub sems dpas mig rtogs par byed /

analyzed: sna yang rna bar mi 'pho /

original: rna ba ni lcer mi 'pho; lce yang rna bar mi 'pho /🔽rna ba ni lus su mi 'pho /
analyzed: rna ba ni lcer mi 'pho; lce yang rna bar mi 'pho / rna ba ni lus su mi 'pho /
translated: The tongue does not transfer into the ears.🔽The ears do not transfer into the body.

original: lus kyang rna bar mi 'pho /🔽rna ba ni yid du mi 'pho /
analyzed: lus kyang rna bar mi 'pho / rna ba ni yid du mi 'pho /
translated: The body does not transfer into the ears.🔽The ears do not transfer into the mind.

original: yid kyang rna bar mi 'pho /🔽sna ni lcer mi 'pho /
analyzed: yid kyang rna bar mi 'pho / sna ni lcer mi 'pho /
translated: The mind does not transfer into the ears.🔽The nose does not transfer into the tongue.

original: lce yang snar mi 'pho /🔽sna ni lus su mi 'pho /
analyzed: lce yang snar mi 'pho / sna ni lus su mi 'pho /
translated: The tongue does not transfer into the nose.🔽The nose does not transfer into the body.

original: lus kyang snar mi 'pho /🔽sna ni yid du mi 'pho /
analyzed: lus kyang snar mi 'pho / sna ni yid du mi 'pho /
translated: The body does not transfer into the nose.🔽The nose does not transfer into the mind.

original: yid kyang snar mi 'pho /🔽lce ni lus su mi 'pho /
analyzed: yid kyang snar mi 'pho / lce ni lus su mi 'pho /
translated: The mind does not transfer into the nose.🔽The tongue does not transfer into the body.

original: lus kyang lcer mi 'pho /🔽lce ni yid du mi 'pho /
analyzed: lus kyang lcer mi 'pho / lce ni yid du mi 'pho /
translated: The body does not transfer into the tongue.🔽The tongue does not transfer into the mind.

original: yid kyang lcer mi 'pho /🔽lus ni yid du mi 'pho /
analyzed: yid kyang lcer mi 'pho / lus ni yid du mi 'pho /
translated: The mind does not transfer into the tongue.🔽The body does not transfer into the mind.

original: yid kyang lus su mi 'pho zhing /🔽chos de dag gi spyod yul tha dad pa /
analyzed: yid kyang lus su mi 'pho zhing / chos de dag gi spyod yul tha dad pa /
translated: The mind does not transfer into the body.🔽The spheres of those phenomena are different.

original: yul tha dad pa /🔽blun pa / bem po sems pa med pa /
analyzed: yul tha dad pa / blun pa / bem po sems pa med pa /
translated: Their objects are different.🔽They are stupid, inert, and without thought.🔽They are unmoving.

original: g-yo ba med pa /🔽byed pa med pa /
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa /🔽byed pa med pa /
translated: They are inactive.

original: rtsva dang / rtsig pa lta bur snang ba /
analyzed: rtsva dang / rtsig pa lta bur snang ba /
translated: They are like grass and walls.

original: sgyu ma lta bur rnam par rig pa med pa /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bur rnam par rig pa med pa /
translated: They are like illusions, without any awareness.

original: mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa ste /
translated: They are without characteristics, but are of one characteristic.

original: de dag ni 'pho bar mi byed /
analyzed: de dag ni 'pho bar mi byed /
translated: They do not move,

original: 'ong bar mi byed /
analyzed: 'ong bar mi byed /
translated: do not come,

original: 'gro bar mi byed pa'i @47b phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro bar mi byed pa'i @47b phyir ro //
translated: and do not go.

original: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' gang de ltar shes par byed pa de ni chos gang la yang 'pho bar mi byed cing /
analyzed: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' gang de ltar shes par byed pa de ni chos gang la yang 'pho bar mi byed cing /
translated: “Son of a god, the bodhisattva who understands in this way does not move from any phenomenon.

original: sar yang rnam par rtog par mi byed /
analyzed: sar yang rnam par rtog par mi byed /
translated: He does not conceptualize the levels.

original: sar 'phar bar yang mi mthong /
analyzed: sar 'phar bar yang mi mthong /
translated: He does not see the levels as something to be attained.

original: sa yongs su spong bar yang mi byed de /
analyzed: sa yongs su spong bar yang mi byed de /
translated: He does not abandon the levels.

original: 'pho ba med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'pho ba med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no movement and no destruction,

original: byang chub las ldog par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub las ldog par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: he does not turn away from awakening.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: chos thams cad gzod ma nas rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad gzod ma nas rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
translated: Because all phenomena are primordially pure.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni 'pho ba med cing 'jig pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni 'pho ba med cing 'jig pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The nature of the aggregates, elements, and sense-spheres is without transition and without destruction.

original: lha'i bu / de ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa nas sar 'phar ba yin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu / de ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa nas sar 'phar ba yin no //
translated: Divine son, this is the bodhisattvas’ leap from ground to ground.

original: lha'i bu / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu / 'di lta ste /
translated: Divine son, it is like this:

original: dper na / sgyu ma mkhan zhig gis sa bcu'i khang pa brtsegs pa zhig mngon par sprul nas /
analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma mkhan zhig gis sa bcu'i khang pa brtsegs pa zhig mngon par sprul nas /
translated: An illusionist conjures a ten-storied palace,

original: der sgyu ma'i mi zhig zhugs par gyur na /
analyzed: der sgyu ma'i mi zhig zhugs par gyur na /
translated: and an illusory person enters it.

original: lha'i bu / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: lha'i bu / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Divine son, what do you think?

original: der zhugs pa 'ga' yang yod snyam mam /🔽lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: der zhugs pa 'ga' yang yod snyam mam / lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: Is there anyone who has entered it?”

original: 'jam dpal / de ni ma mchis so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de ni ma mchis so //
translated: The god replied, “Mañjuśrī, there is not.”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

original: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcur 'phar ba yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcur 'phar ba yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: “Divine son, the leap from the ten bodhisattva grounds should be seen in the same way.”

original: de nas lha'i bu blo gros rab gnas kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu blo gros rab gnas kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the god Stable Intellect said to Mañjuśrī, the youthful one, “Mañjuśrī, how should one understand the bodhisattvas’ leap from ground to ground?”

original: 'jam dpal / la la zhig rab tu 'byung ba'i slad du khyod kyi thad du mchis na /🔽rab tu 'byung ba de la khyod ji skad gsung zhing /🔽de rab tu ni ji ltar 'byin /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / la la zhig rab tu 'byung ba'i slad du khyod kyi thad du mchis na / rab tu 'byung ba de la khyod ji skad gsung zhing / de rab tu ni ji ltar 'byin /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if someone were to come to you seeking ordination,🔽how would you ordain them?

original: de bsnyen par rdzogs par ni ji ltar mdzad /🔽tshul khrims kyi phung po la ni ji @48a *//
analyzed: de bsnyen par rdzogs par ni ji ltar mdzad / tshul khrims kyi phung po la ni ji @48a *//
translated: How would you give them full ordination?🔽How would you instruct them in the aggregate of morality?

original: ltar sbyor / bslab pa'i lung ni ji skad 'bogs par mdzad /
analyzed: ltar sbyor / bslab pa'i lung ni ji skad 'bogs par mdzad /
translated: How would you give them the precepts?

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /🔽lha'i bu / la la zhig rab tu 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa / lha'i bu / la la zhig rab tu 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied,🔽“Divine son, if someone were to come to me seeking ordination,

original: kho bo'i thad du 'ongs na; de la kho bo 'di skad ces rigs kyi bu gal te khyod rab tu 'byung ba'i sems bskyed par mi byed pa de lta na /
analyzed: kho bo'i thad du 'ongs na; de la kho bo 'di skad ces rigs kyi bu gal te khyod rab tu 'byung ba'i sems bskyed par mi byed pa de lta na /
translated: I would tell them, ‘Noble son, if you do not give rise to the mind of ordination,

original: kho bos khyod rab tu dbyung ngo zhes smra'o //
analyzed: kho bos khyod rab tu dbyung ngo zhes smra'o //
translated: then I will ordain you.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lha'i bu / gang rab tu 'byung ba de ni 'dod pa'i khams su gnas pa'am /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gang rab tu 'byung ba de ni 'dod pa'i khams su gnas pa'am /
translated: Divine son, those who seek ordination remain in the desire realm,

original: gzugs kyi khams su gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su gnas pa'am /
translated: remain in the form realm,

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su gnas pa'am /
translated: They are not dwelling in the formless realm,🔽and they are not dwelling in the five sense pleasures.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la gnas pa yin la; gnas dgu la spyod pa'i rigs kyi bu ni chos mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la gnas pa yin la; gnas dgu la spyod pa'i rigs kyi bu ni chos mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Divine son, the sons of noble family who practice in these nine abodes actualize the teachings.

original: lha'i bu / dgu gang zhe na /🔽gang ci la yang mi gnas pa de ni sems nye bar dmigs par mi byed pa dang / sems nye bar dmigs par mi byed pa de ni rab tu 'byung bar mi 'dod pa dang / gang rab tu 'byung bar mi 'dod pa de ni rab tu 'byung ba'i sems bskyed par mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: lha'i bu / dgu gang zhe na / gang ci la yang mi gnas pa de ni sems nye bar dmigs par mi byed pa dang / sems nye bar dmigs par mi byed pa de ni rab tu 'byung bar mi 'dod pa dang / gang rab tu 'byung bar mi 'dod pa de ni rab tu 'byung ba'i sems bskyed par mi byed pa dang /
translated: Divine son, what are these nine?🔽They are not dwelling in anything, they do not observe the mind, they do not wish to go forth, they do not give rise to the thought of going forth,

original: gang rab tu 'byung ba'i sems bskyed par mi byed pa de ni mi skye ba dang / gang mi skye ba de ni sdug bsngal zad pa dang / gang sdug bsngal zad pa de ni gtan zad pa dang / gang gtan zad pa de ni mi zad pa dang /
analyzed: gang rab tu 'byung ba'i sems bskyed par mi byed pa de ni mi skye ba dang / gang mi skye ba de ni sdug bsngal zad pa dang / gang sdug bsngal zad pa de ni gtan zad pa dang / gang gtan zad pa de ni mi zad pa dang /
translated: they do not give rise to the thought of going forth, they do not give rise to anything, they do not end suffering, they do not end anything, they do not end forever, and they do not end anything that does not end.

original: gang mi zad pa de ni zad par mi 'gyur ba dang / gang zad par mi 'gyur ba de ni nam mkha' yin pa ste /
analyzed: gang mi zad pa de ni zad par mi 'gyur ba dang / gang zad par mi 'gyur ba de ni nam mkha' yin pa ste /
translated: That which is inexhaustible is not exhausted, and that which is not exhausted is space.

original: lha'i bu / kho bo ni rigs kyi bu de la de skad smra'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu / kho bo ni rigs kyi bu de la de skad smra'o //
translated: Divine son, I speak to that son of noble family in this way.

original: lha'i bu / gzhan @48b yang la la zhig rab tu 'byung ba'i phyir kho bo'i thad du 'ongs na /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gzhan @48b yang la la zhig rab tu 'byung ba'i phyir kho bo'i thad du 'ongs na /
translated: “Divine son, moreover, if someone were to come to me in order to go forth,

original: de la kho bo 'di skad ces rigs kyi bu khyod rab tu 'byung ba'i sems ma bskyed cig /
analyzed: de la kho bo 'di skad ces rigs kyi bu khyod rab tu 'byung ba'i sems ma bskyed cig /
translated: I would say to them, ‘Son of noble family, do not arouse the thought of going forth.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar sems de ni skye ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems de ni skye ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that thought is unborn.

original: de rnam par ma dkrugs shig /
analyzed: de rnam par ma dkrugs shig /
translated: Do not disturb it.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gal te khyod skra 'breg pa mi byed pa de lta na khyod legs par rab tu byung ba yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: gal te khyod skra 'breg pa mi byed pa de lta na khyod legs par rab tu byung ba yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: if you do not shave your head, then you are well gone forth.’

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The god said,

original: 'jam dpal khyod ci las dgongs te de skad ston /
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod ci las dgongs te de skad ston /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, what do you intend by teaching this?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,🔽“Divine son, I do not intend anything by teaching this.

original: lha'i bu / de bzhin gshegs pa ni gcad du med pa dang / dbyer med pa'i phyir chos ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: lha'i bu / de bzhin gshegs pa ni gcad du med pa dang / dbyer med pa'i phyir chos ston par mdzad do //
translated: Devaputra, the Tathagata teaches the Dharma because he is indivisible and inseparable.

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The Devaputra said:

original: 'jam dpal / ci zhig gcod par mi bgyid cing /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ci zhig gcod par mi bgyid cing /
translated: Manjusri, what is it that is not cut?

original: ci zhig 'byed par mi bgyid /
analyzed: ci zhig 'byed par mi bgyid /
translated: What is it that is not separated?

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Manjusri replied:

original: lha'i bu / gzugs ni gcod par mi byed cing 'byed par mi byed do //
analyzed: lha'i bu / gzugs ni gcod par mi byed cing 'byed par mi byed do //
translated: Devaputra, form is not cut and is not separated.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni gcod par mi byed cing 'byed par mi byed do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni gcod par mi byed cing 'byed par mi byed do //
translated: Feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are not cut and are not separated.

original: lha'i bu / gang 'di snyam du bdag gis skra breg go snyam du sems pa de ni /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gang 'di snyam du bdag gis skra breg go snyam du sems pa de ni /
translated: Devaputra, if one thinks, 'I will shave my head,'

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa la gnas pa yin pas /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa la gnas pa yin pas /
translated: then one is abiding in the grasping of 'I' and 'mine.'

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa la spyod pa dag gis ni mnyam pa nyid mi mthong zhing /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa la spyod pa dag gis ni mnyam pa nyid mi mthong zhing /
translated: Those who engage in the grasping of 'I' and 'mine' do not see equality.

original: bdag tu dmigs pa yod na skrar dmigs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bdag tu dmigs pa yod na skrar dmigs par 'gyur la /
translated: If there is the observation of a self, there will be the observation of hair.

original: skrar dmigs pa yod na sems can du dmigs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: skrar dmigs pa yod na sems can du dmigs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: If there is an observation of hair, there is an observation of sentient beings.

original: sems can du dmigs pa yod na 'breg pa'i 'du shes 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can du dmigs pa yod na 'breg pa'i 'du shes 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is an observation of sentient beings, there is the idea of shaving.

original: lha'i bu / gang la @49a *//
analyzed: lha'i bu / gang la @49a *//
translated: Divine son,

original: bdag tu dmigs pa med pa de la gzhan du dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: bdag tu dmigs pa med pa de la gzhan du dmigs pa med do //
translated: where there is no observation of a self, there is no observation of others.

original: gang la gzhan du dmigs pa med pa de la ngar 'dzin pa med do //
analyzed: gang la gzhan du dmigs pa med pa de la ngar 'dzin pa med do //
translated: Where there is no observation of others, there is no grasping at an “I.”

original: gang la ngar 'dzin pa med pa des nga yir 'dzin pa spangs so //
analyzed: gang la ngar 'dzin pa med pa des nga yir 'dzin pa spangs so //
translated: Where there is no grasping at an “I,” there is the abandonment of grasping at “mine.”

original: gang gis nga yir 'dzin pa spangs pa de rnam par mi rtog go /🔽gang rnam par mi rtog pa de mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis nga yir 'dzin pa spangs pa de rnam par mi rtog go / gang rnam par mi rtog pa de mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Where there is the abandonment of grasping at “mine,” there is no conceptualization.🔽Where there is no conceptualization, there is no change.

original: gang mi 'gyur ba de ni spros pa med do //🔽spros pa med pa de mi len /
analyzed: gang mi 'gyur ba de ni spros pa med do // spros pa med pa de mi len /
translated: Where there is no change, there is no conceptual elaboration.🔽Where there is no conceptual elaboration, there is no grasping,

original: mi 'dor / mi byed /🔽'jig par mi byed /🔽mi gcod / mi 'byed /🔽mi sbyor / mi 'bral /
analyzed: mi 'dor / mi byed / 'jig par mi byed / mi gcod / mi 'byed / mi sbyor / mi 'bral /
translated: no rejecting, no doing,🔽no destroying, no cutting,🔽no separating, no joining, no separating,

original: mi nur / mi spong zhing /🔽'bri bar mi byed /
analyzed: mi nur / mi spong zhing / 'bri bar mi byed /
translated: no contracting, no expanding,

original: gang bar mi byed /🔽sdud par mi byed /🔽'phro bar mi byed /
analyzed: gang bar mi byed / sdud par mi byed / 'phro bar mi byed /
translated: no diminishing,🔽no filling, no gathering,

original: rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: no scattering, and no conceit.

original: smra bar mi byed /🔽rjod par mi byed /
analyzed: smra bar mi byed / rjod par mi byed /
translated: He does not speak,🔽he does not express,

original: rab tu rjod par mi byed de /
analyzed: rab tu rjod par mi byed de /
translated: he does not utter anything.

original: de ni yang dag pa la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa la gnas pa yin no //
translated: He abides in reality.

original: lha'i bus smras pa; 'jam dpal /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa; 'jam dpal /
translated: The god said, “Mañjuśrī,

original: yang dag pa zhes bgyi ba ci lags /
analyzed: yang dag pa zhes bgyi ba ci lags /
translated: what is reality?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said, “Divine son,

original: lha'i bu / gang yang dag pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gang yang dag pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' ste /
translated: what is called reality is space.🔽Space does not decrease

original: nam mkha' ni 'grib pa'am /🔽'phel ba'am / 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni 'grib pa'am / 'phel ba'am / 'byung ba'am /
translated: or increase,

original: 'jig par mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'jig par mi 'gyur bas /
translated: nor does it arise or disintegrate.

original: de'i phyir nam mkha' de ni yang dag pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nam mkha' de ni yang dag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, space is reality.

original: yang dag pa ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag pa ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: Reality is emptiness.

original: yang dag pa ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag pa ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: Reality is suchness.

original: yang dag pa ni chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ni chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: Reality is the realm of phenomena.

original: yang dag pa ni yang dag pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ni yang dag pa'i mtha'o //
translated: Reality is the limit of reality.

original: yang dag pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: That which is reality

original: ma byung ba'o //
analyzed: ma byung ba'o //
translated: is unborn.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni ma byung zhing 'byung bar mi @49b 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni ma byung zhing 'byung bar mi @49b 'gyur bas /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because it does not arise and will not arise,

original: de'i phyir de ni ma byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni ma byung ba yin no //
translated: it is unborn.

original: lha'i bu / gzhan yang la la zhig rab tu 'byung ba'i phyir kho bo'i thad du 'ongs na /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gzhan yang la la zhig rab tu 'byung ba'i phyir kho bo'i thad du 'ongs na /
translated: “Moreover, Devaputra, if someone were to come to me for the sake of going forth,

original: de la kho bos 'di skad ces rigs kyi bu gal te khyod ngur smrig 'dzin par mi byed cing gyon par mi byed pa de lta na khyod rab tu dbyung ngo zhes smra'o //
analyzed: de la kho bos 'di skad ces rigs kyi bu gal te khyod ngur smrig 'dzin par mi byed cing gyon par mi byed pa de lta na khyod rab tu dbyung ngo zhes smra'o //
translated: I would say to him, ‘Noble son, if you do not take up and do not wear the saffron robes, then I will give you going forth.’

original: lha'i bus smras pa /🔽'jam dpal khyod ci las dgongs te /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa / 'jam dpal khyod ci las dgongs te /
translated: ” The Devaputra said,

original: de skad ston /
analyzed: de skad ston /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, what do you think when you teach like this?🔽”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

original: lha'i bu; de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir chos ston par mdzad kyi /
analyzed: lha'i bu; de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir chos ston par mdzad kyi /

analyzed: de la mnyam pa nyid gang zhe na /

original: lha'i bu / gzhan yang 'dod chags sel bar byed pa dang / zhe sdang sel bar byed pa dang / gti mug sel bar byed pa dang / sred pa dang / ma rig pa dang / 'jig tshogs dang / 'jig tshogs kyi rtsa ba las byung ba lta ba'i rnam pa drug cu rtsa gnyis sel bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gzhan yang 'dod chags sel bar byed pa dang / zhe sdang sel bar byed pa dang / gti mug sel bar byed pa dang / sred pa dang / ma rig pa dang / 'jig tshogs dang / 'jig tshogs kyi rtsa ba las byung ba lta ba'i rnam pa drug cu rtsa gnyis sel bar byed pa dang /
translated: Moreover, son of the gods, it is the dispelling of desire, the dispelling of anger, the dispelling of ignorance, the dispelling of craving, the dispelling of ignorance, the dispelling of the view of the transitory collection and the sixty-two views that arise from the root of the view of the transitory collection,

original: phyin ci log rnams sel bar byed pa dang / nyes par spyod pa gsum dang / log pa nyid brgyad dang / kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po dgu dang / mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam sel bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag par rdzogs par bsnyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log rnams sel bar byed pa dang / nyes par spyod pa gsum dang / log pa nyid brgyad dang / kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po dgu dang / mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam sel bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag par rdzogs par bsnyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the dispelling of the four errors, the dispelling of the eight perversions, the dispelling of the nine grounds for resentment, and the dispelling of the ten unwholesome courses of action.

original: lha'i bu / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu / 'di lta ste /
translated: Son of the gods, it is like this:

original: dper na / sa gzhi la brten nas sa bon thams cad skye shing /
analyzed: dper na / sa gzhi la brten nas sa bon thams cad skye shing /
translated: All seeds grow in dependence on the earth.

original: rtsva dang / shing gel pa dang / sman dang / nags tshal rnams kyang skye ba de dag 'phel ba na rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtsva dang / shing gel pa dang / sman dang / nags tshal rnams kyang skye ba de dag 'phel ba na rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The grass, thickets, medicinal herbs, and forests that grow from them are called “perfected” when they have grown and reached completion.

original: lha'i bu / de bzhin du gang dag bstan pa 'di rdzogs par byed pa de dag kyang rdzogs par bsnyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu / de bzhin du gang dag bstan pa 'di rdzogs par byed pa de dag kyang rdzogs par bsnyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Divine Prince, in the same way, those who perfect this teaching are called “perfected in their practice.”

original: lha'i bu / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu / 'di lta ste /
translated: Divine Prince, it is like this:

original: dper na / sa chen po ni sa bon thams cad kyi rten te /
analyzed: dper na / sa chen po ni sa bon thams cad kyi rten te /
translated: the great earth is the support for all seeds.

original: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: You should see perfect morality in the same way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshul khrims la brten nas chos mngon @52b par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims la brten nas chos mngon @52b par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the realization of the Dharma is based on morality.

original: ji ltar sa bon rnams dang / ji ltar sman rnams rnam par 'phel ba la rdzogs pa zhes bya ba de bzhin du tshul khrims dang dad pa la brten pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos thams cad skye zhing rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar sa bon rnams dang / ji ltar sman rnams rnam par 'phel ba la rdzogs pa zhes bya ba de bzhin du tshul khrims dang dad pa la brten pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos thams cad skye zhing rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Just as seeds and medicinal herbs are called “perfected” when they have grown and reached completion, in the same way, all the factors of awakening and wholesome qualities that are based on morality and faith will be born and perfected.

original: lha'i bu / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po de dag rtogs shing spros pa thams cad yang dag par chad pa gang yin pa de ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos thams cad kyi rdzogs par bsnyen pa yin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po de dag rtogs shing spros pa thams cad yang dag par chad pa gang yin pa de ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos thams cad kyi rdzogs par bsnyen pa yin no //
translated: “Son of the gods, those who understand these three gates of liberation and cut through all elaborations are the fully ordained monks of all the Bhagavān Buddhas of the past, present, and future.

original: lha'i bu / gang de ltar rdzogs par bsnyen par byed pa ni yang dag par rdzogs par bsnyen par byed pa yin gyi mi mnyam par ma yin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu / gang de ltar rdzogs par bsnyen par byed pa ni yang dag par rdzogs par bsnyen par byed pa yin gyi mi mnyam par ma yin no //
translated: “Son of the gods, those who are fully ordained in this way are truly fully ordained, not falsely.🔽“Son of the gods, I also teach to those who have gone forth in this way and are fully ordained in this way as follows:

original: lha'i bu / gzhan yang de ltar rab tu byung zhing de ltar rdzogs par bsnyen pa de la kho bos 'di skad ces; rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gzhan yang de ltar rab tu byung zhing de ltar rdzogs par bsnyen pa de la kho bos 'di skad ces; rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‘Son of a good family,

original: gal te khyod bslab pa len par mi byed pa de ltar na /🔽khyod bslab pa 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te khyod bslab pa len par mi byed pa de ltar na / khyod bslab pa 'dod pa yin no //
translated: if you do not take up the trainings,

original: zhes rjes su bstan pa sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes rjes su bstan pa sbyin par bya'o //
translated: then you are one who desires the trainings.’

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: “The son of the gods said,🔽“

original: 'jam dpal khyod ci las dgongs te de skad ston /
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod ci las dgongs te de skad ston /
translated: Mañjuśrī, what do you think of this?

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied:

original: lha'i bu / chos thams cad ni ma blangs pa yin pas /
analyzed: lha'i bu / chos thams cad ni ma blangs pa yin pas /
translated: “Divine son, all phenomena are unaccepted.

original: lha'i bu / gang tshul khrims len pa de ni khams gsum len pa yin no; ;lha'i bu /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gang tshul khrims len pa de ni khams gsum len pa yin no; ;lha'i bu /
translated: Divine son, to accept discipline is to accept the three realms.

original: 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Divine son, what do you think of this?

original: bslab pa de gang yin snyam /
analyzed: bslab pa de gang yin snyam /
translated: What is this training?”

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The god said:

original: 'jam dpal / so sor thar pa'i sdom pa gang lags pa'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / so sor thar pa'i sdom pa gang lags pa'o //
translated: “Mañjuśrī, it is the prātimokṣa vow.”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said:

original: lha'i bu / @53a *//
analyzed: lha'i bu / @53a *//
translated: “Divine son,

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yang gang yin /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yang gang yin /
translated: what is the prātimokṣa vow?”

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The god said:

original: 'jam dpal / sdom pa zhes bgyi ba ni lus sdom pa dang / ngag sdom pa dang / yid sdom pa ste; de ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa zhes bgyi'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / sdom pa zhes bgyi ba ni lus sdom pa dang / ngag sdom pa dang / yid sdom pa ste; de ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa zhes bgyi'o //
translated: “Mañjuśrī, the so-called vow is the vow of body, speech, and mind, and that is called the prātimokṣa vow.”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said:

original: lha'i bu / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: lha'i bu / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Divine son, what do you think of this?

original: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis ma byas /
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis ma byas /
translated: Is it not the case that the body, speech, and mind are uncreated?”

original: mi byed / byed par mi 'gyur ba'i las gang yin pa de la sngon po'am /
analyzed: mi byed / byed par mi 'gyur ba'i las gang yin pa de la sngon po'am /
translated: Is it possible to designate a karma that is not done, that will not be done, as being blue,

original: ser po'am / dmar po'am /
analyzed: ser po'am / dmar po'am /
translated: yellow, red,

original: dkar po'am / btsod ka'am /
analyzed: dkar po'am / btsod ka'am /
translated: white, crimson,

original: shel gyi kha dog lta bu'o zhes gdags par nus snyam mam /🔽lha'i bus smras pa /🔽'jam dpal / de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: shel gyi kha dog lta bu'o zhes gdags par nus snyam mam / lha'i bus smras pa / 'jam dpal / de ni ma lags so //
translated: or the color of crystal?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /🔽lha'i bu / 'o na ji skad brjod par bya /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa / lha'i bu / 'o na ji skad brjod par bya /
translated: The god said, “Mañjuśrī, that is not possible.”

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said, “Divine son, then how should it be described?”

original: 'jam dpal / mngon par 'du bgyi ba ma mchis pa zhes brjod par bgyi ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / mngon par 'du bgyi ba ma mchis pa zhes brjod par bgyi ste /
translated: The god said, “Mañjuśrī, it should be described as being beyond activity.

original: de ni lus kyi las sam /
analyzed: de ni lus kyi las sam /
translated: It cannot be designated as an activity of the body,

original: ngag gi las sam /
analyzed: ngag gi las sam /
translated: an activity of speech,

original: yid kyi las zhes gdags par rdo  mi thog go /🔽'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: yid kyi las zhes gdags par rdo  mi thog go / 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: or an activity of the mind.”

original: lha'i bu / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: lha'i bu / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Mañjuśrī said, “Divine son, what do you think?

original: gang mngon par 'du bya ba med pa de blang bar nus snyam mam /🔽lha'i bus smras pa /🔽'jam dpal / de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: gang mngon par 'du bya ba med pa de blang bar nus snyam mam / lha'i bus smras pa / 'jam dpal / de ni ma lags so //
translated: Is it possible to take up that which is beyond activity?”🔽The god said, “Mañjuśrī, that is not possible.”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

original: lha'i bu / de'i phyir kho bo ni de las bsams nas /
analyzed: lha'i bu / de'i phyir kho bo ni de las bsams nas /
translated: “Son of a god, therefore I think this way:

original: de skad ces gang bslab pa len par mi byed pa de bslab pa 'dod pa yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: de skad ces gang bslab pa len par mi byed pa de bslab pa 'dod pa yin no zhes ston to //
translated: I teach that those who do not take up the training have a desire for the training.

original: lha'i bu / lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa dang / lhag @53b pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de yang mtha' de nyid kyis rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu / lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa dang / lhag @53b pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de yang mtha' de nyid kyis rtogs par bya ste /
translated: “Son of a god, you should understand that what are called the training in the higher morality, the training in the higher mind, and the training in the higher wisdom are also like that limit.

original: tshul khrims mi dmigs pas lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims mi dmigs pas lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because morality is not apprehended, it is called the training in the higher morality.

original: sems mi dmigs pas lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems mi dmigs pas lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because mind is not apprehended, it is called the training in the higher mind.

original: shes rab mi dmigs pas lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab mi dmigs pas lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because wisdom is not apprehended, it is called the training in the higher wisdom.

original: sems rtog pa med pa dang / rlom sems med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / skye ba med pas lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems rtog pa med pa dang / rlom sems med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / skye ba med pas lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because mind is nonconceptual, nonimaginative, nonanalytical, and nonarisen, it is called the training in the higher mind.

original: tshul khrims rtog pa med pa dang / rlom sems med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / skye ba med pas lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims rtog pa med pa dang / rlom sems med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / skye ba med pas lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The training in superior morality is called that because morality is nonconceptual, non-apprehending, non-discriminating, and non-arising.

original: shes rab rtog pa med pa dang / rlom sems med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / skye ba med pas lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab rtog pa med pa dang / rlom sems med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / skye ba med pas lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The training in superior wisdom is called that because wisdom is nonconceptual, non-apprehending, non-discriminating, and non-arising.

original: lha'i bu / gang gis sems ma rnyed pa de tshul khrims su rlom sems mi byed do //
analyzed: lha'i bu / gang gis sems ma rnyed pa de tshul khrims su rlom sems mi byed do //
translated: “Son of a god, those who do not find the mind do not falsely project morality.

original: gang tshul khrims su rlom sems mi byed pa des ting nge 'dzin mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gang tshul khrims su rlom sems mi byed pa des ting nge 'dzin mi dmigs so //
translated: Those who do not falsely project morality do not apprehend meditative absorption.

original: gang gis ting nge 'dzin mi dmigs pa des shes rab mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gang gis ting nge 'dzin mi dmigs pa des shes rab mi dmigs so //
translated: Those who do not apprehend meditative absorption do not apprehend wisdom.

original: gang gis shes rab mi dmigs pa de la the tshom thams cad mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gis shes rab mi dmigs pa de la the tshom thams cad mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Those who do not apprehend wisdom do not have any doubts.

original: gang la the tshom thams cad mi 'byung ba de bslab pa mi len to //
analyzed: gang la the tshom thams cad mi 'byung ba de bslab pa mi len to //
translated: Those who do not have any doubts do not take up any training.

original: gang bslab pa mi len pa de bslab pa 'dod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang bslab pa mi len pa de bslab pa 'dod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Whoever does not take up the training is said to be desirous of the training.

original: gang bslab pa 'dod pa de phyir mi 'ong ba'o //🔽gang phyir mi 'ong ba de rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: gang bslab pa 'dod pa de phyir mi 'ong ba'o // gang phyir mi 'ong ba de rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Whoever is desirous of the training is a non-returner.🔽Whoever is a non-returner is pure.

original: gang rnam par dag pa de bral ba'o //
analyzed: gang rnam par dag pa de bral ba'o //
translated: Whoever is pure is free.
